content:
EncryptedSecurityTokenHandler Class

In this Article

A token handler for encrypted security tokens. Handles tokens of type EncryptedSecurityToken.

Syntax

Declaration

public class EncryptedSecurityTokenHandler : System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler
  • EncryptedSecurityTokenHandler

Inherited Members

CanReadToken(String)
,
CanValidateToken
,
CanWriteKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)
,
Configuration
,
ContainingCollection
,
CreateSecurityTokenReference(SecurityToken,Boolean)
,
CreateToken(SecurityTokenDescriptor)
,
DetectReplayedToken(SecurityToken)
,
LoadCustomConfiguration(XmlNodeList)
,
ReadToken(String)
,
ReadToken(XmlReader,SecurityTokenResolver)
,
TraceTokenValidationFailure(SecurityToken,String)
,
TraceTokenValidationSuccess(SecurityToken)
,
ValidateToken(SecurityToken)
,
WriteKeyIdentifierClause(XmlWriter,SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)
,
WriteToken(SecurityToken)
,
Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

A token handler that serializes and deserializes EncryptedSecurityToken objects from <xenc:EncryptedData> elements and EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause objects from <xenc:EncryptedKey> elements as defined in the XML Encryption Syntax and Processing specification (http://www.w3.org/TR/2002/REC-xmlenc-core-20021210).

Constructors summary

EncryptedSecurityTokenHandler()

Initializes a new instance of the EncryptedSecurityTokenHandler class.

Properties summary

CanWriteToken

Gets a value that indicates whether the handler provides serialization functionality for tokens.
KeyInfoSerializer

Gets or sets the SecurityTokenSerializer that will be used to serialize and deserialize key identifiers from the <xenc:EncryptedData> element.
TokenType

Gets the type of the token handled by the current instance.

Methods summary

CanReadKeyIdentifierClause(XmlReader)

Returns a value that indicates whether the current XML element is pointing to an <xenc:EncryptedKey> element that can be deserialized to a SecurityKeyIdentifierClause by this instance.
CanReadToken(XmlReader)

Returns a value that indicates whether the reader is pointing to an <xenc:EncryptedData> element.
GetTokenTypeIdentifiers()

Gets the type identifier URIs for tokens handled by the current instance.
ReadKeyIdentifierClause(XmlReader)

Reads an EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause from an XML stream.
ReadToken(XmlReader)

Reads an encrypted security token.
WriteToken(XmlWriter,SecurityToken)

Writes an encrypted security token using the XML writer.

Constructors

  • EncryptedSecurityTokenHandler()

    Initializes a new instance of the EncryptedSecurityTokenHandler class.

    public EncryptedSecurityTokenHandler ();

Properties

  • CanWriteToken

    Gets a value that indicates whether the handler provides serialization functionality for tokens.

    public override bool CanWriteToken { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the handler can serialize tokens; otherwise, false. Always true.

  • KeyInfoSerializer

    Gets or sets the SecurityTokenSerializer that will be used to serialize and deserialize key identifiers from the <xenc:EncryptedData> element.

    public System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer KeyInfoSerializer { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • SecurityTokenSerializer

      The token serializer that will be used to read and write key the key identifiers.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      An attempt to set the property to null occurs.

  • TokenType

    Gets the type of the token handled by the current instance.

    public override Type TokenType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      The token type handled by the current instance. The default is typeofEncryptedSecurityToken.

Methods

  • CanReadKeyIdentifierClause(XmlReader)

    Returns a value that indicates whether the current XML element is pointing to an <xenc:EncryptedKey> element that can be deserialized to a SecurityKeyIdentifierClause by this instance.

    public override bool CanReadKeyIdentifierClause (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      An XML reader positioned at the start element. The reader should not be advanced.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the XML reader is positioned at an <xenc:EncryptedKey> element as defined in section 3.5.1 of the XML Encryption Syntax and Processing specification (http://www.w3.org/TR/2002/REC-xmlenc-core-20021210); otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      reader is null.

  • CanReadToken(XmlReader)

    Returns a value that indicates whether the reader is pointing to an <xenc:EncryptedData> element.

    public override bool CanReadToken (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      The reader positioned at a security token (<xenc:EncryptedData> element.)

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the reader is positioned at an <xenc:EncryptedData> element; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Does not move the reader when it returns false.

  • GetTokenTypeIdentifiers()

    Gets the type identifier URIs for tokens handled by the current instance.

    public override string[] GetTokenTypeIdentifiers ();

    Returns

    • String[]

      By default, returns an array with a single null string because there is not a specific token type identifier that is associated with the EncryptedSecurityToken type.

  • ReadKeyIdentifierClause(XmlReader)

    Reads an EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause from an XML stream.

    public override System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause ReadKeyIdentifierClause (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      An XML reader positioned at an <xenc:EncryptedKey> element as defined in 'http://www.w3.org/TR/2002/REC-xmlenc-core-20021210'; otherwise, false.

    Returns

    • SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

      A key identifier clause of type EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      reader is null.

    • InvalidOperationException

      reader is not positioned at an <xenc:EncryptedKey> element.

  • ReadToken(XmlReader)

    Reads an encrypted security token.

    public override System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken ReadToken (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      The reader from which to read the token.

    Returns

    • SecurityToken

      A security token of type EncryptedSecurityToken.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      reader is null.

    • InvalidOperationException

      There is no configured service token resolver. (Either the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.Configuration* property or the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration.ServiceTokenResolver* property of the referenced token handler configuration is null. A service token resolver is required to obtain keys for decryption.

      -or-

      The SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionReferenced through the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.ContainingCollection* property is unable to find a SecurityTokenHandler that can read the decrypted XML and return a SecurityToken.

    • SecurityTokenException

      A SecurityKeyIdentifier is not found inside the XML pointed to by the reader.

      -or-

      The SecurityKeyIdentifier is not a SymmetricSecurityKey.

    • EncryptedTokenDecryptionFailedException

      The SecurityKeyIdentifier found inside the XML cannot be resolved by the configured service token resolver to a SecurityKey.

  • WriteToken(XmlWriter,SecurityToken)

    Writes an encrypted security token using the XML writer.

    public override void WriteToken (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token);

    Parameters

    • writer
      XmlWriter

      The XML writer to which to write the encrypted token.

    • token
      SecurityToken

      The encrypted security token, must be an instance of EncryptedSecurityToken.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      writer is null.

      -or-

      token is null.

    • ArgumentException

      token is not assignable as EncryptedSecurityToken.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.Configuration* property is null. This property is required for obtaining keys for encryption.

      -or-

      The token handler collection returned by the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.ContainingCollection* property was unable to find a SecurityTokenHandler that can write the SecurityToken returned by the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedSecurityToken.Token* property.

    • SecurityTokenException

      The stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials.SecurityKey* property is not assignable as SymmetricSecurityKey.
